customer_name: Laredo Safari and Adventure Park LLC
site_name: Laredo Safari and Adventure Park LLC

citations.narrative:
A young female Patagonian Cavy was being housed in a wire dog crate in the gift shop. The Cavy did not have adequate
space to move around and make normal postural adjustments. She could only take 2-3 steps before having to turn around
and she could not move around without knocking her food and water bowl over. Limited space and range of movement
can create mental stress, debility, and abnormal behavior patterns. Enclosures shall be constructed and maintained so as
to provide sufficient space to allow each animal to make normal postural and social adjustments with adequate freedom of
movement. Correct by Feb 14, 2024

The young female Patagonian Cavy housed in a dog crate in the gift shop area did not have access to water at the time of
inspection. Both the water bottle attached to the side and the bowl in the cage were empty. When the bowl was filled with
water, she drank for longer than a minute. Water is essential to life and lack of water can lead to excessive thirst and
suffering. Water must be provided as often as necessary to provide for the health and comfort of the animal. Corrected at
the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the owner.
Additional Inspectors:
ANN GOPLEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.128 
   
Space requirements. 
A young female Patagonian Cavy was being housed in a wire dog crate in the gift shop. The Cavy did not have adequate 
space to move around and make normal postural adjustments. She could only take 2-3 steps before having to turn around 
and she could not move around without knocking her food and water bowl over. Limited space and range of movement 
can create mental stress, debility, and abnormal behavior patterns. Enclosures shall be constructed and maintained so as 
to provide sufficient space to allow each animal to make normal postural and social adjustments with adequate freedom of 
movement. Correct by Feb 14, 2024 
3.130  Repeat
   
Watering. 
The young female Patagonian Cavy housed in a dog crate in the gift shop area did not have access to water at the time of 
inspection. Both the water bottle attached to the side and the bowl in the cage were empty. When the bowl was filled with 
water, she drank for longer than a minute. Water is essential to life and lack of water can lead to excessive thirst and 
suffering. Water must be provided as often as necessary to provide for the health and comfort of the animal. Corrected at 
the time of inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the owner. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
ANN GOPLEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
